t: 2 Samuel 22
David’s Song of Praise
David*p sang to the Lord*s the words of this song when the Lord*s delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.
He said: “The*pn Lord*s is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer;
my*ld God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my*ld shield and the horn of my salvation. He*ln is my stronghold, my refuge and my savior— from*ld violent people you save me.
“I*pn called to the Lord,*s who is worthy of praise, and*ld have been saved from my enemies.
The*ln waves of death swirled about me; the*ld torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.
The*ln cords of the grave coiled around me; the*ld snares of death confronted me.
“In*pn my distress I called to the Lord;*s I*ld called out to my God. From*ln his temple he heard my voice; my*ld cry came to his ears.
The*ln earth trembled and quaked, the*ld foundations of the heavens shook; they*ld trembled because he was angry.
Smoke*ln rose from his nostrils; consuming*ld fire came from his mouth, burning*ld coals blazed out of it.
He*ln parted the heavens and came down; dark*ld clouds were under his feet.
He*ln mounted the cherubim and flew; he*ld soared on the wings of the wind.
He*ln made darkness his canopy around him— the*ld dark rain clouds of the sky.
Out*ln of the brightness of his presence bolts*ld of lightning blazed forth.

He*ln shot his arrows and scattered the enemy, with*ld great bolts of lightning he routed them.
The*ln valleys of the sea were exposed and*ld the foundations of the earth laid bare at*ln the rebuke of the Lord,*s at*ld the blast of breath from his nostrils.
“He*pn reached down from on high and took hold of me; he*ld drew me out of deep waters.
He*ln rescued me from my powerful enemy, from*ld my foes, who were too strong for me.
They*ln confronted me in the day of my disaster, but*ld the Lord*s was my support.

“The*pn Lord*s has dealt with me according to my righteousness; according*ld to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.
For*ln I have kept the ways of the Lord;*s I*ld am not guilty of turning from my God.
All*ln his laws are before me; I*ld have not turned away from his decrees.
I*ln have been blameless before him and*ld have kept myself from sin.
The*ln Lord*s has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according*ld to my cleanness in his sight.
“To*pn the faithful you show yourself faithful, to*ld the blameless you show yourself blameless,
to*ln the pure you show yourself pure, but*ld to the devious you show yourself shrewd.
You*ln save the humble, but*ld your eyes are on the haughty to bring them low.
You,*ln Lord,*s are my lamp; the*ld Lord*s turns my darkness into light.

“As*pn for God, his way is perfect: The*ld Lord’s*s word is flawless; he*ld shields all who take refuge in him.
For*ln who is God besides the Lord?*s And*ld who is the Rock except our God?
It*ln is God who arms me with strength and*ld keeps my way secure.
He*ln makes my feet like the feet of a deer; he*ld causes me to stand on the heights.

“I*pn pursued my enemies and crushed them; I*ld did not turn back till they were destroyed.
I*ln crushed them completely, and they could not rise; they*ld fell beneath my feet.
You*ln armed me with strength for battle; you*ld humbled my adversaries before me.

“You*pn have delivered me from the attacks of the peoples; you*ld have preserved me as the head of nations. People*ln I did not know now serve me,
foreigners*ld cower before me; as*ld soon as they hear of me, they obey me.
They*ln all lose heart; they*ld come trembling from their strongholds.
